page.title: 06The Library Theatre
page.content: One of the new, modern facilities in our town centre. The Library Theatre was built in 1976. Lots of houses were knocked down to make room for it. When the theatre was opened in 1977 the first performance was 'La Belle Helene'. There is a rule that once a show has been performed, it cannot come back for another four years. All the shows are of a very high standard. Mr. Johns, the manager, thinks that with the Birmingham Theatres there are enough to cover the area. He has worked there since it opened and wants to move into the computer age with some new control equipment. The theatre can hold 340 in its auditorium and has bar and coffee lounge facvilities.Tickets for other theatres can be booked at the box office.
